The source of the claim: The expert's verdict mentions that the claim originated from a post on Facebook by the page "Ek Bihari 100 Pe Bhari." The page has a modest following of over 36,000, but the post has been shared over 4000 times. It has also been posted on the group "Main Bhi Chowkidar."
The content of the claim: The claim involves a photograph of Bollywood actors Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone wearing saffron scarves with the text "Vote for BJP N Modi" printed on them. The accompanying text in the post encourages people to press the lotus button and become a part of the nation's progress.
Verification of the claim: The expert's verdict states that the image has been digitally altered. Alt News conducted a reverse image search and found the original photograph, which was clicked on November 30, 2018, when Singh and Padukone visited the Siddhivinayak temple in Mumbai. The original picture shows them wearing plain saffron scarves, not BJP scarves.
Additional information: The expert's verdict also mentions an update regarding Deepika Padukone's visit to JNU in solidarity with injured students. The image is being circulated with a caption mocking those criticizing the actor, highlighting the hypocrisy of labeling her as anti-national. This update provides context and adds to the understanding of the claim's authenticity.
